ast.name: CityRail
ast.comment: App to view timetables for Australian trains.

body.text: Begin application
Create board, text, buttons and background
Sleep for appearance of app startup
Requires an internet connection to scrape data.

elseBody.text: No internet connection so give an error message

body.text: Constructs and downloads the data from the specified url.

Url Style: http://www.131500.com.au/plan-your-trip/trip-planner?itd_anyObjFilter_origin=2&itd_name_origin=maitland%20station&itd_anyObjFilter_destination=2&itd_name_destination=warabrook%20university&itd_itdTripDateTimeDepArr=dep&itd_itdDate=20130419&itd_itdTimeHour=02&itd_itdTimeMinute=20&itd_itdTimeAMPM=pm&chkPlannerRemember=1&
Concatenate values together to construct URL
Display a message so the user knows the app is busy, set colour and position
Download constructed URL data
Remove busy message as download is finished
Find the nearest train station to the user based on their current location and give them directions
Searches through the downloaded html data, grabbing the required timetable data.
currentPosition is used when searching through htmlData to ensure current place is not lost
loopCounter is used to determine when the loop should end, as well as current colour for each trip
textHeight is used to control the height of the text outputs during the loop
colourCollection is used to hold a collection of colours to be used for trip text
Add colours to the collection
This loop contains the logic required to scrape the correct html data
Create a new record container
Loop 6 times as there are 5 possible header values for each trip
Set the new currentPosition in htmlData
Get the next colour from the colourCollection
Create trip text and set colour and position on the board
Create departure text and set colour and position on the board
Create arrival text and set colour and position on the board
Statements to create buttons with text and set their positions on the board
Create legend text for the + on trainTimes and set position
Create legend text for the - on trainTimes and set position
All data is now shown, give the phone a quick vibrate to notify the user it has finished

decls.name: foundData
decls.comment: Contains data parsed from the htmlData variable.

body.text: Used to gather the users data requirements for download
Remove unnecessary buttons and text
Display a message so the user knows the app is busy
Start downloading list of train stations for display
Remove busy message
Ask user for train station origin
Temporary collection is created to remove the users selected origin, this will stop the user selecting the same origin and destination.
Ask user for train station destination
Create a string collection of numbers, this will be used to ask the user for a time
Website can give results before or after a given time, rather than flood the user with another prompt, we want the results before the given time. i.e. arrive before this time rather than after
Possible values: arr and dep

thenBody.text: User selected now, so get current date and time values

elseBody.text: User selected later, ask for values
Ask user for the hour to arrive before
While the user hasn't given a valid date, ask again

body.text: If trainTimeMinute only has a count of 1, we need to add a leading 0
If trainDay only has a count of 1, then we need to add a leading 0
If trainMonth only has a count of 1, then we need to add a leading 0
Construct the URL and download results
Remove brackets for easier display later on
Remove brackets for easier display later on
Downloads a list of current and up to date train stations
stationData contains the downloaded list of train stations
foundStations is used to hold the latest station found in stationData
currentPosition is used to hold the last substring position when searching though html text for a station
There are multiple train station lists, listCounter is used to make sure only the first list is read
stationCollection is used to contain all found stations
Aberdeen is added here as it is the first in the list and is used later on as a checker value against multiple lists
This loop requires the logic to scrape html from the train stations web page
Aberdeen is used as a check value due to the html data containing multiple station lists

thenBody.text: The domestic and international airports throw errors, so don't add

The found stations are added to the global stationOriginCollection
